snippet: Republican opposition ensured that a measure pressed by President Obama and Senate Democrats to raise effective tax rates for the superrich would not come to a decisive vote.
abstract: Senate Republicans block a move to open debate on the so-called Buffett Rule, ensuring that a measure pressed for months by Pres Obama and Senate Democrats to ensure that the super-rich pay a tax rate of at least 30 percent will not come to a decisive vote.
lead_paragraph: Republican opposition ensured that a measure pressed by President Obama and Senate Democrats to raise effective tax rates for the superrich would not come to a decisive vote.

headline.main: In Senate, Republicans Block Debate on ‘Buffett Rule’
headline.print_headline: Senate Republicans Block Debate on ‘Buffett Rule’
